Class Sorting

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sorting

  • public class Sorting
extends java.lang.Object

    This is a class that creates an array and then sort the array by implementing insertion sort (under 32 items), merge sort and quick sort if more items given.

    Author:
    multiple authors

      DescriptionThis is a method that compares four different sorting algorithms (mergeSort, mergeSort2, quickSort, quickSort2) by calculating the time spent while generating and sorting 100 random arrays of size 10,000,000.

      Test run result:
      merge sort 106,764 ms.
      merge sort II 98,823 ms.

      • insertSort

        private static void insertSort(int left,
                               int right)
        Description: It runs insertion sort of a sub-array by having its start and end place.
        Parameters:
        left - starting point of one subarray/array
        right - end of an array

      • insertionSort

        private static void insertionSort()
        Description: It calls the insertSort method according to the size of the array from this.size

      • maxHeapify

        private static void maxHeapify(int i,
                               int n)
        Description: This adjusts subtree to rotate the MAX to the root.
        Parameters:
        i - the left and right subtrees of node i are max heaps.
        n - make the tree rooted at node i as max heap of n nodes.

      • heapsort

        private static void heapsort()
        Description: This method practices heapsort.

      • mergeSort

        private static void mergeSort(int low,
                              int high)
        Description: This method sorts an array using merge sort.
        Parameters:
        low - starting place in a (sub)array
        high - ending place in a (sub)array

      • mergeSort2

        private static void mergeSort2(int low,
                               int high)
        Description: This method sorts an array using merge sort, but when the sub-arrays have less than 32 elements, it switches to insertion.
        Parameters:
        low - starting place in a (sub)array
        high - ending place in a (sub)array

      • merge

        private static void merge(int low,
                          int middle,
                          int high)
        Description: This method merges two array in order. From merge arr[low, middle-1] and arr[middle, high-1] into arr[low, high-1].
        Parameters:
        low - as the beginning point in the first sub-array
        middle - the ending point of the first sub-array and the beginning point in the second sub-array
        high - the ending point of the second sub-array

      • naturalMergeSort

        private static void naturalMergeSort()
        Description: Natural merge sort sorts an array by splitting an array to several smaller arrays using a fixed length.

      • quickSort

        private static void quickSort(int low,
                              int high)
        Description: This method uses quick sort. It sets a pivot to a random number then put all numbers greater than the pivot to one side, and other numbers less than the pivot to the other.
        Parameters:
        low - starting point in an array
        high - ending point in an array

      • quickSort2

        private static void quickSort2(int low,
                               int high)
        Description: This method runs the quick sort first and then when the sub-array has less than 32 elements, it runs in insertion sort.
        Parameters:
        low - starting point in an array
        high - ending point in an array

      • demo1

        public static void demo1(java.lang.String input)
        Description:This method is a demo program. It asks user the number of wanted elements, then sort them in heap, merge, natural merge, and quick sort.
        Parameters:
        input - This is a string of whatever it has in the main. Now, it's set to "random", and it could be changed in main.

      • demo2

        public static void demo2(java.lang.String input)
        Description: This method utilizes heap, merge, natural merge, and quick sort to sort a nearly sorted array. (It tries to show that insertion sort is faster when it comes to a nearly sorted array)
        Parameters:
        input - a descriptor for the array

      • task1

        private static void task1(java.lang.String input)
        DescriptionThis is a method that compares four different sorting algorithms (mergeSort, mergeSort2, quickSort, quickSort2) by calculating the time spent while generating and sorting 100 random arrays of size 10,000,000.

        Test run result:
        merge sort 106,764 ms.
        merge sort II 98,823 ms. (-8s improvement)
        quick sort 81,978 ms.
        quick sort II 71,078 ms. (-11s improvement)

        Conclusion: when the size of an sub-array is less than 32, insertion sort works better. However, it's not a significant improvement on running speed.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
